# File lib/flex_times.rb, line 161
  def datetime_column(*columns)
    columns.each do |column|
      define_method("#{column}=") do |param|
        if param.is_a?(Hash)
            if !self.send("#{column}").nil?
              right_now = self.send("#{column}")
            else
              right_now = Time.now
            end
            param = param.symbolize_keys
            # make sure any undefined sub-fields are populated
            default_time = { :year => right_now.year, :month => right_now.month, 
                          :day => right_now.day, :hour => right_now.hour, 
                          :minute => right_now.minute, :second => right_now.second,
                          :ampm => "" }
            time_hash = default_time.update(param)
            
            # Convert back to 24-hour time for DB compatibility
            if time_hash[:ampm] == "AM" && time_hash[:hour].to_i == 12
              time_hash[:hour] = 0 
            end
            if time_hash[:ampm] == "PM" && time_hash[:hour].to_i != 12
              time_hash[:hour] = time_hash[:hour].to_i + 12
            end
            
            # Parse out into a real time
            real_time = Time.local(time_hash[:year], time_hash[:month], time_hash[:day],
                               time_hash[:hour], time_hash[:minute], time_hash[:second])
                               
            # Assign the attribute with a properly formatted time
            write_attribute("#{column}", real_time)
          else
          # Assume it's text -- no smart functionality
            write_attribute("#{column}", param)  
          end
        end 
      end
    end
